name: 044_throne_room_scroll_no_hedgehog
description: cant win due to no hedgehog
expected_full_outputs:
Unlocked

Openned. 

Your score is now 10 out of 75

*** Gatehouse ***

The following items are here: a Shiny Sword. 

The Royal Hedgehog is here. The Royal Hedgehog is wearing: a Red Bandana.

Openned. The Paper Bag contains: a Baked Biscuit. 

With a yelp of grateful delight the starving hedgehog leaps upon the Baked Biscuit and begins to devour them.

The Royal Hedgehog is ravenously devouring the Stale Biscuits and is taking no notice of you at all.

Taken

Your score is now 20 out of 75

With the Shiny Sword in hand you are now armed and dangerous!

The Royal Hedgehog has eaten through half the Stale Biscuits but is still giving them all of its attention.

Your sword is glowing with a faint blue glow.

*** Entrance ***

The following items are here: a Big Rock. 

Your sword is no longer glowing.

With courage and boldness to spare you leap from the drawbridge into the murky waters of the Moat. A less resolute adventurer might have turned tail at the sight of the oncoming giant crocodile but not you Burt. Treading water with your feet you take a two-handed grip on the shiny sword (now blazing so brightly it appears engulfed in blue flame) and get ready to face your destiny. Just before reaching you the primitive reptile realizes that you are armed and ready to fight (crocs are famously near-sighted). In surprise and fear it belches up the contents of it's stomach - including the Royal Crown - and flees in fear. With a deft athleticism unlike anything you've ever displayed before today you stow the shiny sword, snag the Royal Crown before it sinks, and in one smooth motion adroitly hoist yourself back onto the drawbridge one handed. The lads at the pub would fall over at the sight of your skill and courage! (though mind you, they fall over on a regular basis as it is)

With the Shiny Sword no longer in hand, you are a bit more approachable.

Worn.

You now feel more regal.

Your score is now 30 out of 75

Taken

With the Shiny Sword in hand you are now armed and dangerous!

*** Gatehouse ***

The Royal Hedgehog is here. The Royal Hedgehog is wearing: a Red Bandana.

Your sword is glowing with a faint blue glow.

*** Antechamber ***

The Guard Goblin is here. The Guard Goblin is holding a Grimy Axe. The Guard Goblin is wearing: a Big Medal.

Your sword has begun to glow very brightly

(with the Shiny Sword)

You attack with the Shiny Sword and the Guard Goblin attempts to parry with the Grimy Axe!

The Shiny Sword surges with power and lethal heft in your hand. A preternatural calm comes over you. You were born for this moment. Your raucous pub crawling days were a mere temporary distraction. You know in your bones that this primal showdown was meant to be and that, with the Shiny Sword at your command, you were meant to win it. Resolute, and with a confidence you have never even imagined having up until this very moment, you stride forward to meet your foe in battle.

The Shiny Sword swings through the air with a blazing-fast assault. The Guard Goblin is slain by the blazing-fast strike! 

Your score is now 35 out of 75

Your sword is no longer glowing.

Pulled. The Left Lever is now up.

Pulled. The Right Lever is now up.

Pushed.

You hear a loud clank, a whirring of gears, and the Iron Portcullis suddenly opens.

Your score is now 45 out of 75

*** Gatehouse ***

The Royal Hedgehog is here. The Royal Hedgehog is wearing: a Red Bandana.

The hedgehog beams at you with gratitude and Loyalty for returning the Shiny Sword. From a hidden fold of its fur it takes out a silver key and, bowing, places it in your hand.

Your score is now 50 out of 75

With the Shiny Sword no longer in hand, you are a bit more approachable.

*** Antechamber ***

The following items are here: a Torn Note, a Grimy Axe, and a Big Medal. 

*** Throne Room ***

(with the Silver Key)

Unlocked

Openned. The Crystal Box contains: a Kinging Scroll. 

*** Antechamber ***

The following items are here: a Torn Note, a Grimy Axe, and a Big Medal. 

Taken

With the Grimy Axe in hand you are now armed and dangerous!

*** Gatehouse ***

The Royal Hedgehog is here. The Royal Hedgehog is holding a Shiny Sword. The Royal Hedgehog is wearing: a Red Bandana.

(with the Grimy Axe)

BURT! What has gotten into you?? We have an evil castle to conquer. Stop trying to slay defenseless woodland creatures!

(with the Grimy Axe)

Burt, I mean it - leave the poor little Hedgehog alone!

(with the Grimy Axe)

Don't say I didn't warn you burt...

You attack with the Grimy Axe and the Royal Hedgehog attempts to parry with the Shiny Sword!

The Royal Hedgehog squeeks in dismay as it dodges your malevolent agression. It's loyal gaze changes to one of bewilderment and hearbreak. 'Et tu Burtus?' Even as the loyal little creature gives way, you know in your heart that you will come to regret this unkingly deed.

The Grimy Axe arcs through the air with a lightening-fast stroke. The Royal Hedgehog is terrirfied and flees from the unprovoked attack. 

Your score is now 30 out of 75

*** Antechamber ***

The following items are here: a Torn Note and a Big Medal. 

*** Throne Room ***

You are now seated in the Throne.

Sitting in the throne, it feels slightly out of kilter - as if it's been pushed or pulled out of alignment by something...

From your position on the Throne you can just reach: Crystal Box

The Crystal Box is already open.

Taken

Your score is now 35 out of 75

With the Grimy Axe no longer in hand, you are a bit more approachable.

Wow this thing is fancy! Huge letters with little pictures inside them and all sorts of curvy flourish at the end of each and every letter. Burt, your humble biscuit-baking, pub-crawling brain doesn't even know what to call this thing but if it did you would call it an illuminated manuscript composed (of course) of illuminated letters. Thanks to the hard and thankless work of your first grade teacher, Ms. Lusk, you could probably just manage to read the illuminated letters.

On the Kinging Scroll you see: Illuminated Letters. 

First with great effort and then, surprisingly, with surety and confidence, you read out loud the text on the scroll. Your voice booms forth of its own accord - as if some part of your brain has been getting ready to say these words all your life. The rest of brain is struggling just to make sense of what you're saying with such confidence... it seems to be something along the lines of a recipe with ingredients... so if the 'heir to the true king' (whoever that might be)... reads 'this precious parchment'(you're pretty sure that means the scroll you're holding)... in the Throne Room (you've been there!)... while 'adorned with the gleaming headpiece of state and seated upon our royal cathedra' (whatever that means)... and also requiring that 'so long as the castle remains invested with a representative of our most noble heraldic charge seen ever upon our crest, seal, and glorious coat of arms' (even Ms. Lusk would have no clue what this means but she would notice that an awful lot of the illuminated letters in this sentence include a hedgehog with a sword and a key)... and then it finishes on a rather dramatic high note with the words 'upon the hour these conditions be met, a new King of Bright Castle shall shine forth and be proclaimed!'

Upon reading the kinging scroll aloud, there is a rumble and a bright flash of light in the sky.. but then it dims and the sound fades. Alas, some vital ingredient has gone missing in the castle... this is grim Burt... you may need to start your adventures over from the start and play through with a more benevolent spirit.

You are now standing in the Throne Room.

*** Antechamber ***

The following items are here: a Torn Note and a Big Medal. 

*** Gatehouse ***

*** Entrance ***

The following items are here: a Big Rock.
